body: Are you using an nvidia GPU? To get a useful backtrace it would probably be nice to compile Alacritty from source if possible.
I'm using an AMD Vega 64 GPU, do I need to set any debug flags on compile?
No, just run it using `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo run` and see if it crashes. That should print all the debug info necessary.

That looks better

Would you mind providing some info about your setup, like multiple monitors or smthing like that, and are you running alacritty with default config?

Yeah, looking at the error, it seems like you don't have any output connected? It would also be nice if you could test if the examlpes of https://github.com/rust-windowing/glutin crash too. You can run them using `cargo run --example window`.

> Would you mind providing some info about your setup, like multiple monitors or smthing like that, and are you running alacritty with default config?

I just have the one monitor connected via HDMI, I'm not running the default config, but it does work fine in xorg. I deleted my custom config and ran alacritty and it worked fine, it looks like a configuration handling issue.


> Yeah, looking at the error, it seems like you don't have any output connected? It would also be nice if you could test if the examlpes of https://github.com/rust-windowing/glutin crash too. You can run them using `cargo run --example window`.

glutin works fine.
That sounds like it was recently fixed upstream. I'd assume that the #2438 also works then?

That PR does actually show an error with the config, but it still dies.

@sjug What's your `sturtup_mode` in a config, It's `Fullscreen`, right? So try setting it to `Windowed` and then toggling fullscreen.

Oh yeah, this only seems to crash when executing `current_monitor` which is not done by the examples by default. You'll have to run `cargo run --example fullscreen` in the glutin examples and then press `F` to toggle it to fullscreen. That should crash it, right?

@chrisduerr Right on
